Reason: The configuration option 'compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the speed and efficiency of data compaction processes. A higher value for this configuration can lead to faster compaction but may also increase resource consumption, while a lower value can result in slower compaction and potential bottlenecks in the system. Therefore, changes in this configuration can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and memory usage.
